replies.body: Really sad that {{champion:266}} Aatrox's revive got removed in his ult. Removing that is also removing one of Aatrox's unique identities and strengths in League as a whole and is one reason I like to play him. I hope one day it returns though even in a different form again.
It was also the only thing that was in his old kit. Not the most successful rework
are you joking

Reworks are successful when the essence of the reworked champion is still in the game. The Aatrox rework already got rid of most of his essence. Then they got rid of the only thing left from it and he is now an entirely new champion.

The revive on his ult didn't really thematically fit with his lore. He never truly dies, yet is in a constant state of decay and regrowth using the flesh of his fallen enemies. He is immortal, yet the body he wields is not. He has to constantly rend new flesh for his mortal form, lest it fall apart and he be trapped within the sword. His kit needs to stay focused more on the lifesteal to fit thematically with his lore.
Yah that's why when he got a kill before he went down, he mended himself with the flesh of the fallen. It totally made sense thematically in it's last iteration.
Then his abilities should cost a percentage of his health

Yea, but currently, as hashinshin even stated, his revive was just an unfun mechanic that contributed to his snowballing potential. How a stupid teammate could just run into Aatrox q and die giving him a revive to run away. Although it was what shined in old aatrox, it was just an all around unfun mechanic.

“Revive is an unfun mechanic” is all it takes for it to be removed? Might as well remove Zilean ult then. Or Guardian Angel. Or Sion/Kog’Maw passives. Or Karthus passive so he can’t keep damaging you after he dies.

The point being, just because something isn’t fun to play against, doesn’t mean it should be removed. Aatrox’s revive was a core part of who he was. He was supposed to be this immortal badass demon and riot took that “immortal” part away in the sake of balance. Now he’s just a worse Riven.

Galio is the prototype failure for modern LOL. Complete loss of what the champ was designed to be, and ends up being good at nothing.
You took away Irelia's shield breaking and now you want anti-class shield breaking back. Nice...

I think that was because Irelia is/was already overloaded. Having a passive that increases attack speed and damage along with shield busting (+ the rest of her kit) is pretty powerful to have on 1 champion. By distributing this power to other classes, you side step the issue of having Irelia be turbo loaded while increasing other champ viability. Whether or not Renekton was a good candidate for this buff, is a different story, but I'd like to see how he does for this patch.

Also, it should be noted that Irelia was just extra DAMAGE to shields, while this is a more binary shield broken yes/no mechanic. This is a better version of the mechanic since the version on Irelia and Aatrox would have to require tuning every time they changed either Irelia's damage or the strength of shields/shielding items.

So basically the laning phase might be hell now...they could've lessen the amount of mana she receives but don't out right take it out she's already squishy and not much adc's like to play with her.

She’s at a hard spot. Right now she’s a strong early harasser and a strong late game steroids buff. By removing some of her early game strength, it should balance her out a bit more, if you saw, they really buffed Zoomies early. (Sorta like what was done with Soraka).
No actual Yuumi player wants to be an AFK Heal bot.

The Aatrox changes are a melting point. With the complete removal of revive, there are zero mechanic/kit similarities with old and new Aatrox.
I might be being harsh here, but I think that makes this a failed rework. It would've been better to keep old Aatrox and release the current version of Aatrox in the future as a brand new champion. Now, we lost the old Aatrox for practically nothing.

Since they cant back track a rework (riot is a company and backtracking is bad pr) i think they just wanted to balance at this point. I agree with getting rid of the "infinite revive" thing where you get a revive from ult, ga, and maybe even a zilean if their team is that insane.

Reverting his rework would be an entire VGU in itself. He doesn't have the old animations on his new rig so they'd have to do all that + SFX etc. again.

but at this point, he's a Riven rework not an Aatrox.
If you want to boil it down he is very similar to riven now. 3 part q, cc w, dash e, more damage ultimate plus both can benefit from sustain like conqueror and deaths dance.

These changes are overall buffs for Akali. She can be revealed in her shroud and her ult cooldown is longer, but her shroud has more uptime, she gets a huge boost in damage, and she has more energy to work with in the early game. If the enemy doesn't have a spell that reveals people, her shroud is the same as before but on a shorter cooldown and she has more damage.

As someone who still enjoyed akali, this is actually a major nerf and all people have to do is keep control wards and she's utterly useless. She's hardly been buffed, with how many nerfs been handed to her over and over. The champ was already reworked, at this point they should revert her back to her entire old kit because that Shroud nerf won't work with this akali well.
Umm, control wards won't counter her at all... She has invisibility not camouflage.

The shroud cooldown is only better for her early and she was already super strong early. After lvl 10 her shroud is on longer cooldown then it is currently on 9.13 which makes her teamfight harder in the stages of the game where she's already harder to pull off.

Yeah but she has an overall AP ratio increase of 1.1 in her full combo which is massive, not even mentioning how her q cd is also super low. The main issue I've noticed is that akali players tend to fall off because they stop doing enough damage to oneshot an adc, and the adc lifesteals up and kills her once shroud ends. Now she will be a potent damage threat at all stages.

Hi! I was curious which category neeko, galio, jayce, yuumi and renekton fall into to receive their respective nerfs/buffs. 

Neeko and galio received nerfs while sitting below the threshold at all levels for a nerf.

Jayce and yuumi received buffs while sitting above at least the pro-play presence threshold for buffs.

Renekton also is sitting at a high pick/ban rate in pro play, as well as a high presence in soloqueue considered as a high priority pick. And he received a flat buff with shield break.

Maybe I don't have all my statistics right, but I'd love to know what else goes into determining these power changes aside from those numbers you released in life of a patch.

another case of over nerfing. Tahm is op, and does need a nerf, no doubt. but like Ornn and Zac before when the new runes hit, you can over nerf. Why gut these champions when they can be tuned back more reasonably and made viable instead of keeping them op, or making them unplayable? how long will it be until he gets buff to be viable again? will it be quick and be in a couple patches, or the usually 1-2 seasons before he sees any significant buff besides some "3 more flat damage on his Q"?

Vs nearly all melee matchups, Tahm had no counterplay. Once he stacked his passive on u, it was just a constant annoying cc chain until you died. Even if you were tanky enough to survive the first couple rotations, he himself is too inherently tanky to be stopped before he gets another rotation in. You literally cannot play against it in most 
melee matchups.

As a guy who did the top Tahm since S5 when the on-hit was on his ult, I'm pretty happy with these changes for the most part. They buffed his sustain but it's harder for him to just run you down the entire lane, which was always stupid as hell. I also like that they made the correct counterplay to his Q (just stand in your minions, my guy) cleaner, and in general are encouraging him to get the quick W and then end the trade, which feels a lot better and has more counterplay than "Oh I can just chase you from my turret to yours now I guess." Still playable top, still good, hopefully seen more as a counterpick now than a faceroll champ.
Riot, where is Varus' increase to healing reduction? Why do you always forget Varus?! {{sticker:sg-janna}}

The two champions that they added the augmented healing reduction to can only apply it situationally.  Katarina's ult requires her to channel in melee range, and has a 90/60/45 second cooldown (less 15 seconds if she gets a kill/assist).  Kled's Q only applies it on the second part of the ability, so he has to hit his target with a blockable skillshot, then stay in range for 1.75 seconds to tether them for the grievous wounds to actually be applied.  On top of the delay and the ability of the target to avoid it just by walking away after they get hit by Q1, it's also only single-target.

Varus' E, on the other hand, is an aoe with 925 range on an 18-10 second cooldown, and takes effect nearly instantly after casting it.  Increasing the grievous wounds effectiveness on Varus would be a far greater change than the ones to Katarina and Kled.
